description: Borrowing from Latin ēbulliēns, present participle of ēbulliō (“I boil”), from bulliō (“I bubble up”) (English boil). Compare bubbling, bubbly, and perky, which use a similar metaphor.

adjectives.description: ebullient (comparative more ebullient, superlative most ebullient)

entries.meaning: (literally, of a liquid) Boiling or agitated as if boiling.
examples: Synonyms: abubble, bubbly; see also Thesaurus:effervescent
